documentation.text: This is the base class of a metaverse plug-in.
The metaverse that will own this plug-in.
Tells whether this plug-in is initialized into the metaverse or not.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: the owner contract must not be 0"

arguments.value: MetaversePlugin: the owner contract must not be 0

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: the owner contract must not be 0"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: the owner contract must implement IMetaverseRegistrar"

arguments.value: MetaversePlugin: the owner contract must implement IMetaverseRegistrar

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: the owner contract must implement IMetaverseRegistrar"

documentation.text:
Creating a metaverse plug-in requires a valid metaverse
 registrar as its owner.
The title of this metaverse plug-in.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: only the owning metaverse can invoke this method"

arguments.value: MetaversePlugin: only the owning metaverse can invoke this method

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: only the owning metaverse can invoke this method"

documentation.text: This modifier restricts the function to be only invoked by the metaverse.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: only the owning metaverse's economy can invoke this method"

arguments.value: MetaversePlugin: only the owning metaverse's economy can invoke this method

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: only the owning metaverse's economy can invoke this method"

documentation.text: This modifier restricts the function to be only invoked by the metaverse's economy.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: only one of the owning metaverse's plug-ins can invoke this method"

arguments.value: MetaversePlugin: only one of the owning metaverse's plug-ins can invoke this method

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: only one of the owning metaverse's plug-ins can invoke this method"

documentation.text: This modifier restricts the function to be only invoked by a metaverse's plug-in.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: caller is not metaverse owner, and does not have the required permission"

arguments.value: MetaversePlugin: caller is not metaverse owner, and does not have the required permission

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: caller is not metaverse owner, and does not have the required permission"

documentation.text:
This modifier requires a specific permission or being the owner of the
 metaverse to perform an action.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: the address must be a brand"

arguments.value: MetaversePlugin: the address must be a brand

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: the address must be a brand"

documentation.text: This modifier ensures a given parameter

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: caller is not brand owner nor approved, and does not have the required permission"

arguments.value: MetaversePlugin: caller is not brand owner nor approved, and does not have the required permission

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: caller is not brand owner nor approved, and does not have the required permission"

documentation.text:
This modifier requires a specific permission or being the owner of the
 the brand to perform an action.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: this plug-in is not yet initialized"

arguments.value: MetaversePlugin: this plug-in is not yet initialized

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "MetaversePlugin: this plug-in is not yet initialized"

documentation.text: This modifier requires the plug-in to be initialized.

This function holds an implementation (which could be
 empty) for when the plugin is added to the metaverse.
 The implementation requires the sender to be the same
 metaverse that owns this plugin, and the underlying
 implementation is defined by _initialize() instead.

This function holds an implementation (which could be
 empty) for when the plugin is added to the metaverse.

arguments.value: data:application/json;base64,

documentation.text:
This function returns the uri for a given token id, with
 the same semantics of ERC1155. WARNING: this method will
 spend a lot of gas if invoked inside a transaction, so
 doing that is strongly discouraged.

This function builds an appropriate JSON representation of
 a token's metadata (by its id, instead of its type). it must
 actually be a valid JSON (otherwise markets will not render
 it appropriately) returned as a bytes sequence.
A metaverse plugin satisfies the IMetaversePlugin and IERC165.
This is the base class of a metaverse plug-in.

Tells whether this plug-in is initialized into the metaverse or not.

documentation.text: This modifier requires the plug-in to be initialized.

This function holds an implementation (which could be
 empty) for when the plugin is added to the metaverse.
 The implementation requires the sender to be the same
 metaverse that owns this plugin, and the underlying
 implementation is defined by _initialize() instead.

This function holds an implementation (which could be
 empty) for when the plugin is added to the metaverse.

arguments.value: data:application/json;base64,

documentation.text:
This function returns the uri for a given token id, with
 the same semantics of ERC1155. WARNING: this method will
 spend a lot of gas if invoked inside a transaction, so
 doing that is strongly discouraged.

This function builds an appropriate JSON representation of
 a token's metadata (by its id, instead of its type). it must
 actually be a valid JSON (otherwise markets will not render
 it appropriately) returned as a bytes sequence.
A metaverse plugin satisfies the IMetaversePlugin and IERC165.

constructor.notice: Creating a metaverse plug-in requires a valid metaverse registrar as its owner.

initialize().notice: This function holds an implementation (which could be empty) for when the plugin is added to the metaverse. The implementation requires the sender to be the same metaverse that owns this plugin, and the underlying implementation is defined by _initialize() instead.

initialized().notice: Tells whether this plug-in is initialized into the metaverse or not.

metaverse().notice: The metaverse that will own this plug-in.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: A metaverse plugin satisfies the IMetaversePlugin and IERC165.

title().notice: The title of this metaverse plug-in.

uri(uint256).notice: This function returns the uri for a given token id, with the same semantics of ERC1155. WARNING: this method will spend a lot of gas if invoked inside a transaction, so doing that is strongly discouraged.

userdoc.notice: This is the base class of a metaverse plug-in.
